ibis.io
Class IbisSerializationInputStream

java.lang.Object
  ibis.io.IOProperties
      ibis.io.SerializationBase
          ibis.io.ByteSerializationInputStream
              ibis.io.DataSerializationInputStream
                  ibis.io.IbisSerializationInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants, DataInput, SerializationInput
public class IbisSerializationInputStream
extends DataSerializationInputStream

This is the SerializationInputStream version that is used for Ibis serialization.

               throws IOException,

Description copied from interface: SerializationInput
Reads a slice of an array in place. No cycle checks are done.

clear

public void clear()
Description copied from interface: SerializationInput
Ibis serialization profits from an explicit clear of the object table, so that any stubs in it can be garbage-collected. This significantly reduces the number of connections kept alive.

Specified by:
clear in interface SerializationInput
Overrides:
clear in class ByteSerializationInputStream

addObjectToCycleCheck

public void addObjectToCycleCheck(Object o)
Adds an object o to the object table, for cycle checking. This method is public because it gets called from IOGenerator-generated code.

Parameters:
o - the object to be added

getObjectFromCycleCheck

public Object getObjectFromCycleCheck(int handle)
Looks up an object in the object table. This method is public because it gets called from IOGenerator-generated code.

Parameters:
handle - the handle of the object to be looked up
Returns:
the corresponding object.

readKnownTypeHeader

public final int readKnownTypeHeader()
                              throws IOException,
                                     ClassNotFoundException
Method used by IOGenerator-generated code to read a handle, and determine if it has to read a new object or get one from the object table.

Returns:
0 for a null object, -1 for a new object, and the handle for an object already in the object table.
Throws:
IOException - when an IO error occurs.
ClassNotFoundException

readFieldDouble

public void readFieldDouble(Object ref,
                            String fieldname,
                            String classname)
                     throws IOException
This method reads a value from the stream and assigns it to a final field. IOGenerator uses this method when assigning final fields of an object that is rewritten, but super is not, and super is serializable. The problem with this situation is that IOGenerator cannot create a proper constructor for this object, so cannot assign to final fields without falling back to native code.

Parameters:
ref - object with a final field
fieldname - name of the field
classname - the name of the class
Throws:
IOException - is thrown when an IO error occurs.

                          String fieldname,
                          String classname)
                   throws IOException
See readFieldDouble(Object, String, String) for a description.

Throws:
IOException

                            String fieldname,
                            String classname,
                            String fieldsig)

                            ClassNotFoundException

Throws:

IOException

readSerializableObject

public void readSerializableObject(Object ref,
                                   String classname)
                            throws ClassNotFoundException,
                                   IOException
This method takes care of reading the serializable fields of the parent object, and also those of its parent objects. Its gets called by IOGenerator-generated code when an object has a superclass that is serializable but not Ibis serializable.

Parameters:
ref - the object with a non-Ibis-serializable parent object
classname - the name of the superclass
Throws:
IOException - gets thrown on IO error
ClassNotFoundException - when readObject throws it.

defaultReadSerializableObject

public void defaultReadSerializableObject(Object ref,
                                          int depth)
                                   throws ClassNotFoundException,
                                          IOException
This method reads the serializable fields of object ref at the level indicated by depth (see the explanation at the declaration of the current_level field. It gets called from IOGenerator-generated code, when a parent object is serializable but not Ibis serializable.

Parameters:
ref - the object of which serializable fields must be written
depth - an indication of the current "view" of the object
Throws:
IOException - gets thrown when an IO error occurs.
ClassNotFoundException - when readObject throws it.

create_uninitialized_object

public Object create_uninitialized_object(String classname)
                                   throws ClassNotFoundException,
                                          IOException
Creates an uninitialized object of the type indicated by classname. The corresponding constructor called is the parameter-less constructor of the "highest" superclass that is not serializable.

Parameters:
classname - name of the class
Throws:
ClassNotFoundException - when class classname cannot be loaded.
IOException

push_current_object

public void push_current_object(Object ref,
                                int level)
Push the notions of current_object and current_level on their stacks, and set new ones.

Parameters:
ref - the new current_object notion
level - the new current_level notion

pop_current_object

public void pop_current_object()
Pop the notions of current_object and current_level from their stacks.

readString

public String readString()
                  throws IOException
Reads and returns a String object. This is a special case, because strings are written as an UTF.

Specified by:
readString in interface SerializationInput
Overrides:
readString in class DataSerializationInputStream
Returns:
the string read.
Throws:
IOException - gets thrown on IO error
